<!-- LESSON DIVISION -->
<div class="lesson">
<h1>CHAPTER 5  &#8212;  Representing Characters with Bit Patterns </h1>

<p>
<a href="../Audio/chap05-01.mp3" target="audioPlayer" class="audio">P</a>atterns 
of bits
represent many types of things.
This chapter shows how
bit patterns are used to represent characters.
</p>


<p>
<b>Chapter Topics:</b></p>

<ul>
<li>ASCII</li>
<li>Control characters</li>
<li>Teletype Machines</li>
<li><code>.asciiz</code> and null terminated strings</li>
<li>Disk files</li>
<li>Text files</li>
<li>Binary files</li>
<li>Executable files</li>
</ul>

        <div class="clearfloats">  <!-- divs need something inside of them --> </div>
</div> <!-- end lesson -->

<!-- QUESTION DIVISION -->
<div class="question">
<h3> QUESTION 1:</h3>
<p>
What else (besides characters and integers)
can be represented with bit patterns?
</p>

     <a href="DocumentView.php?action=edit&docname=Demo"><img src="imgs/homeIcon.gif" alt="go to home page" /></a> &nbsp;
